content.question: A conducting sphere has a charge <math alttext="negative Q " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>âˆ’</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and is surrounded by a concentric spherical conducting sphere that has no net charge. Which of the following best shows the electric field lines in the region of the two spheres?

choices.label: The figure presents a diagram of a conducting sphere surrounded by a concentric spherical conducting sphere. A vertical, dual ended arrow passes through the center of the conducting sphere, as does a horizontal dual ended arrow. Both dual ended arrows intersect in the center of the sphere and point outwards.

The figure presents a diagram of a conducting sphere surrounded by a concentric spherical conducting sphere. Four arrows point toward the center of the conducting sphere, one from the top, one from the bottom, one from the left, and one from the right.

The figure presents a diagram of a conducting sphere surrounded by a concentric spherical conducting sphere. There are two vertical arrows on the top and bottom of the conducting sphere that touch the surface of the conducting sphere and point inwards toward the center of it. There are 2 horizontal arrows on both sides of the conducting sphere that touch the surface of the conducting sphere and point inwards toward the center of it.

The figure presents a diagram of a conducting sphere surrounded by a concentric spherical conducting sphere. There are two vertical arrows on the top and bottom of the conducting sphere that touch the surface of the conducting sphere and point outwards from the center. There are 2 horizontal arrows on both sides of the conducting sphere that touch the surface of the conducting sphere and point outwards from the center.

The figure presents a diagram of a conducting sphere surrounded by a concentric spherical conducting sphere. There are eight arrows shown pointing inward to the center of the spheres. Four arrows are located at the top and bottom of the sphere, and four arrows are on the sides. Half of the arrows are outside of the concentric conducting sphere and pointing inward, and the other half are located outside the conducting sphere and point inwards.

content.answer: The figure presents a diagram of a conducting sphere surrounded by a concentric spherical conducting sphere. There are eight arrows shown pointing inward to the center of the spheres. Four arrows are located at the top and bottom of the sphere, and four arrows are on the sides. Half of the arrows are outside of the concentric conducting sphere and pointing inward, and the other half are located outside the conducting sphere and point inwards.

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
